intro: Anil echinata, commonly known as the spiny echinata, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Anil echinata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
